text:
Love Island set to return for new series this summer with Caroline Flack returning to host Flack will be back at the helm of the ITV2 show Share Comments By Jessica Gibb 12:13, 14 FEB 2017 TV Caroline Flack Love Island Love Island is set to return this summer with a fresh batch of singletons looking for love.
Caroline Flack will return to host the ITV2 show – and a new spin-off.
A brand new weekly live studio show – filmed in the UK – will see a panel of celebrity guests discuss the show’s drama.
There’ll be exclusive interviews with dumped Islanders and all the gossip from the new series.
Presenter Caroline Flack on Love Island (Photo: ITV2) Show bosses also revealed that Caroline will drop into the villa throughout the series to deliver “shock announcements” and “surprise twists”.
Producers are hoping to test relationships within the villa to the max this season.
Last year’s show saw five couples leave the Island who are still together.
Winners Nathan and Cara, recently engaged Alex and Olivia, Scott and Kady, Terry and Emma, and Rykard and Rachel.
Last year's final couples (Photo: ITV2) Casting is now underway for singletons to take part in this year’s series.
“Last year, Love Island became a real part of the national conversation and now, our new studio show will help feed our viewers’ appetite for mo,” Commissioning editor for ITV Comedy and Entertainment Amanda Stavri said.
“If the twists and turns are anywhere near as fast paced as last year, it looks like Caroline and our studio guests will have plenty to talk about.”
Iain Stirling is the voice behind Love Island Love Island's Iain Stirling who has amassed quite the following since the ITV2 show aired last summer – will also return.
Love Island: Who's the voice behind all those witty one-liners and cutting comments?
The man behind the voice of the hit ITV show Love Island made a brief cameo on screen during the live final, and his appearance sent fans into a frenzy.
Stirling – a Scottish comedian now based in Manchester and London – debuted on 2015's series of the hit reality show.
From pithy one-liners to hilarious observations on the day's goings on, the 28-year-old quickly emerged as a favourite of the ITV2 show.
* Love Island returns to ITV2 in summer 2017
